text: The 77th running of the Tour of Flanders cycling race in Belgium was held on Sunday 4 April 1993. It was the second leg of the 1993 UCI Road World Cup. Belgian Johan Museeuw won his first Tour of Flanders in a two-man sprint against Frans Maassen.Vanwalleghem, Rik (2003), De Ronde van Vlaanderen, Lannoo, Belgium, , p88-89 The race started in Sint-Niklaas and finished in Meerbeke (Ninove). ==Race Summary== At 68 km from the finish, eight riders broke away, with twofold winner Edwig Van Hooydonck and Belgian national champion Johan Museeuw at the front. Museeuw attacked on Tenbosse climb, followed by Dutchman Frans Maassen. Maassen, considered the slower sprinter, refused to work after the Muur van Geraardsbergen. Museeuw and Maassen stayed ahead, with Museeuw controlling the sprint and taking his first win in the World Cup race. Dario Bottaro won the sprint for third. ==Climbs== There were 16 categorized climbs: {| width=65% | valign=top align=left width=33% | * Tiegemberg * Kluisberg * Knokteberg * Oude Kwaremont * Paterberg * Hoogberg- Hotond | valign=top align=left width=34% | * Kruisberg * Bossenaarberg * Eikenberg * Volkegemberg * Varent * Leberg | valign=top align=left width=33% | * Molenberg (Zwalm) * Berendries * Muur-Kapelmuur * Bosberg |} ==Results== {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#ccccff;" ! !Cyclist !Team !Time |- |1 | | GB-MG | align=right| 6h 33' |- |2 | | WordPerfect | align=right| s.t. |- |3 | | Mecair | align=right| + 22" |- |4 | | Histor-Novemail | align=right| + 33" |- |5 | | Motorola | align=right| + 46" |- |6 | | GB-MG | align=right| s.t. |- |7 | | WordPerfect | align=right| s.t. |- |8 | | Lampre | align=right| s.t. |- |9 | | Team Telekom | align=right| + 1' 03" |- |10 | | TVM | align=right| s.t. |} ==References== ==External links== * Recap of the race (Flemish television) * Category:Tour of Flanders Tour of Flanders Tour of Flanders Tour Of Flanders Category:April 1993 sports events in Europe
